name: doubleclicksearch
title: DoubleClick Search API
description: Reports and modifies your advertising data in DoubleClick Search (for example, campaigns, ad groups, keywords, and conversions).

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

schemas.name: Availability
schemas.desc: A message containing availability data relevant to DoubleClick Search.

fields.name: advertiserId
fields.desc: DS advertiser ID.

fields.name: agencyId
fields.desc: DS agency ID.

fields.name: availabilityTimestamp
fields.desc: The time by which all conversions have been uploaded, in epoch millis UTC.

fields.name: segmentationId
fields.desc: The numeric segmentation identifier (for example, DoubleClick Search Floodlight activity ID).

fields.name: segmentationName
fields.desc: The friendly segmentation identifier (for example, DoubleClick Search Floodlight activity name).

fields.name: segmentationType
fields.desc: The segmentation type that this availability is for (its default value is FLOODLIGHT).

fields.name: conversion
fields.desc: The conversions being requested.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a ConversionList resource. Value: the fixed string doubleclicksearch#conversionList.

schemas.name: ReportApiColumnSpec
schemas.desc: A request object used to create a DoubleClick Search report.

fields.name: columnName
fields.desc: Name of a DoubleClick Search column to include in the report.

fields.name: customMetricName
fields.desc: Name of a custom metric to include in the report. The report must be scoped to an advertiser or lower, and the custom metric must already be set up in DoubleClick Search. The custom metric name, which appears in DoubleClick Search, is case sensitive.

fields.name: endDate
fields.desc: Inclusive day in YYYY-MM-DD format. When provided, this overrides the overall time range of the report for this column only. Must be provided together with startDate.

fields.name: groupByColumn
fields.desc: Synchronous report only. Set to true to group by this column. Defaults to false.

fields.name: platformSource
fields.desc: The platform that is used to provide data for the custom dimension. Acceptable values are "floodlight".

fields.name: productReportPerspective
fields.desc:
Returns metrics only for a specific type of product activity. Accepted values are:  
- "sold": returns metrics only for products that were sold 
- "advertised": returns metrics only for products that were advertised in a Shopping campaign, and that might or might not have been sold

fields.name: customDimensionName
fields.desc:
Segments a report by a custom dimension. The report must be scoped to an advertiser or lower, and the custom dimension must already be set up in DoubleClick Search. The custom dimension name, which appears in DoubleClick Search, is case sensitive.
If used in a conversion report, returns the value of the specified custom dimension for the given conversion, if set. This column does not segment the conversion report.

fields.name: headerText
fields.desc: Text used to identify this column in the report output; defaults to columnName or savedColumnName when not specified. This can be used to prevent collisions between DoubleClick Search columns and saved columns with the same name.

fields.name: savedColumnName
fields.desc: Name of a saved column to include in the report. The report must be scoped at advertiser or lower, and this saved column must already be created in the DoubleClick Search UI.

fields.name: startDate
fields.desc: Inclusive date in YYYY-MM-DD format. When provided, this overrides the overall time range of the report for this column only. Must be provided together with endDate.

schemas.name: ReportRequest
schemas.desc: A request object used to create a DoubleClick Search report.

fields.name: columns
fields.desc: The columns to include in the report. This includes both DoubleClick Search columns and saved columns. For DoubleClick Search columns, only the columnName parameter is required. For saved columns only the savedColumnName parameter is required. Both columnName and savedColumnName cannot be set in the same stanza.

fields.name: downloadFormat
fields.desc: Format that the report should be returned in. Currently csv or tsv is supported.

fields.name: filters
fields.desc: A list of filters to be applied to the report.

fields.name: column
fields.desc: Column to perform the filter on. This can be a DoubleClick Search column or a saved column.

fields.name: operator
fields.desc: Operator to use in the filter. See the filter reference for a list of available operators.

fields.name: values
fields.desc: A list of values to filter the column value against.

fields.name: includeDeletedEntities
fields.desc: Determines if removed entities should be included in the report. Defaults to false. Deprecated, please use includeRemovedEntities instead.

fields.name: maxRowsPerFile
fields.desc: Asynchronous report only. The maximum number of rows per report file. A large report is split into many files based on this field. Acceptable values are 1000000 to 100000000, inclusive.

fields.name: orderBy
fields.desc: Synchronous report only. A list of columns and directions defining sorting to be performed on the report rows.

fields.name: column
fields.desc: Column to perform the sort on. This can be a DoubleClick Search-defined column or a saved column.

fields.name: sortOrder
fields.desc: The sort direction, which is either ascending or descending.

fields.name: reportScope
fields.desc: The reportScope is a set of IDs that are used to determine which subset of entities will be returned in the report. The full lineage of IDs from the lowest scoped level desired up through agency is required.

fields.name: agencyId
fields.desc: DS agency ID.

fields.name: campaignId
fields.desc: DS campaign ID.

fields.name: engineAccountId
fields.desc: DS engine account ID.

fields.name: keywordId
fields.desc: DS keyword ID.

fields.name: adGroupId
fields.desc: DS ad group ID.

fields.name: adId
fields.desc: DS ad ID.

fields.name: advertiserId
fields.desc: DS advertiser ID.

fields.name: startRow
fields.desc: Synchronous report only. Zero-based index of the first row to return. Acceptable values are 0 to 50000, inclusive. Defaults to 0.

fields.name: timeRange
fields.desc: If metrics are requested in a report, this argument will be used to restrict the metrics to a specific time range.

fields.name: changedMetricsSinceTimestamp
fields.desc: Inclusive UTC timestamp in RFC format, e.g., 2013-07-16T10:16:23.555Z. See additional references on how changed metrics reports work.

fields.name: endDate
fields.desc: Inclusive date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

fields.name: startDate
fields.desc: Inclusive date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

fields.name: changedAttributesSinceTimestamp
fields.desc: Inclusive UTC timestamp in RFC format, e.g., 2013-07-16T10:16:23.555Z. See additional references on how changed attribute reports work.

fields.name: reportType
fields.desc: Determines the type of rows that are returned in the report. For example, if you specify reportType: keyword, each row in the report will contain data about a keyword. See the Types of Reports reference for the columns that are available for each type.

fields.name: verifySingleTimeZone
fields.desc: If true, the report would only be created if all the requested stat data are sourced from a single timezone. Defaults to false.

fields.name: includeRemovedEntities
fields.desc: Determines if removed entities should be included in the report. Defaults to false.

fields.name: rowCount
fields.desc: Synchronous report only. The maxinum number of rows to return; additional rows are dropped. Acceptable values are 0 to 10000, inclusive. Defaults to 10000.

fields.name: statisticsCurrency
fields.desc: Specifies the currency in which monetary will be returned. Possible values are: usd, agency (valid if the report is scoped to agency or lower), advertiser (valid if the report is scoped to * advertiser or lower), or account (valid if the report is scoped to engine account or lower).

fields.name: availabilities
fields.desc: The availabilities being requested.

schemas.name: UpdateAvailabilityResponse
schemas.desc: The response to a update availability request.

fields.name: availabilities
fields.desc: The availabilities being returned.

schemas.name: Conversion
schemas.desc: A conversion containing data relevant to DoubleClick Search.

fields.name: channel
fields.desc:
Sales channel for the product. Acceptable values are:  
- "local": a physical store 
- "online": an online store

fields.name: countMillis
fields.desc: Available to advertisers only after contacting DoubleClick Search customer support.

fields.name: storeId
fields.desc: The ID of the local store for which the product was advertised. Applicable only when the channel is "local".

fields.name: campaignId
fields.desc: DS campaign ID.

fields.name: revenueMicros
fields.desc: The revenue amount of this TRANSACTION conversion, in micros (value multiplied by 1000000, no decimal). For example, to specify a revenue value of "10" enter "10000000" (10 million) in your request.

fields.name: advertiserId
fields.desc: DS advertiser ID.

fields.name: segmentationName
fields.desc: The friendly segmentation identifier (for example, DoubleClick Search Floodlight activity name).

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The type of the conversion, that is, either ACTION or TRANSACTION. An ACTION conversion is an action by the user that has no monetarily quantifiable value, while a TRANSACTION conversion is an action that does have a monetarily quantifiable value. Examples are email list signups (ACTION) versus ecommerce purchases (TRANSACTION).

fields.name: productLanguage
fields.desc: The language registered for the Merchant Center feed that contains the product. Use an ISO 639 code to specify a language.

fields.name: agencyId
fields.desc: DS agency ID.

fields.name: attributionModel
fields.desc: Available to advertisers only after contacting DoubleClick Search customer support.

fields.name: criterionId
fields.desc: DS criterion (keyword) ID.

fields.name: deviceType
fields.desc: The type of device on which the conversion occurred.

fields.name: inventoryAccountId
fields.desc: ID that DS generates and uses to uniquely identify the inventory account that contains the product.

fields.name: productId
fields.desc: The product ID (SKU).

fields.name: adId
fields.desc: DS ad ID.

fields.name: conversionId
fields.desc:
For offline conversions, advertisers provide this ID. Advertisers can specify any ID that is meaningful to them. Each conversion in a request must specify a unique ID, and the combination of ID and timestamp must be unique amongst all conversions within the advertiser.
For online conversions, DS copies the dsConversionId or floodlightOrderId into this property depending on the advertiser's Floodlight instructions.

fields.name: productCountry
fields.desc: The country registered for the Merchant Center feed that contains the product. Use an ISO 3166 code to specify a country.

fields.name: clickId
fields.desc: DS click ID for the conversion.

fields.name: customDimension
fields.desc: Custom dimensions for the conversion, which can be used to filter data in a report.

fields.name: productGroupId
fields.desc: DS product group ID.

fields.name: segmentationType
fields.desc: The segmentation type of this conversion (for example, FLOODLIGHT).

fields.name: conversionTimestamp
fields.desc: The time at which the conversion took place, in epoch millis UTC.

fields.name: state
fields.desc: The state of the conversion, that is, either ACTIVE or REMOVED. Note: state DELETED is deprecated.

fields.name: conversionModifiedTimestamp
fields.desc: The time at which the conversion was last modified, in epoch millis UTC.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.desc: The currency code for the conversion's revenue. Should be in ISO 4217 alphabetic (3-char) format.

fields.name: customMetric
fields.desc: Custom metrics for the conversion.

fields.name: dsConversionId
fields.desc: ID that DoubleClick Search generates for each conversion.

fields.name: engineAccountId
fields.desc: DS engine account ID.

fields.name: floodlightOrderId
fields.desc: The Floodlight order ID provided by the advertiser for the conversion.

fields.name: quantityMillis
fields.desc: The quantity of this conversion, in millis.

fields.name: adGroupId
fields.desc: DS ad group ID.

fields.name: segmentationId
fields.desc: The numeric segmentation identifier (for example, DoubleClick Search Floodlight activity ID).

schemas.name: CustomDimension
schemas.desc: A message containing the custome dimension.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: Custom dimension name.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: Custom dimension value.

schemas.name: CustomMetric
schemas.desc: A message containing the custome metric.

fields.name: name
fields.desc: Custom metric name.

fields.name: value
fields.desc: Custom metric numeric value.

schemas.name: Report
schemas.desc: A DoubleClick Search report. This object contains the report request, some report metadata such as currency code, and the generated report rows or report files.

fields.name: isReportReady
fields.desc: Asynchronous report only. True if and only if the report has completed successfully and the report files are ready to be downloaded.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a Report resource. Value: the fixed string doubleclicksearch#report.

fields.name: request
fields.desc: The request that created the report. Optional fields not specified in the original request are filled with default values.

fields.name: rowCount
fields.desc: The number of report rows generated by the report, not including headers.

fields.name: files
fields.desc: Asynchronous report only. Contains a list of generated report files once the report has succesfully completed.

fields.name: byteCount
fields.desc: The size of this report file in bytes.

fields.name: url
fields.desc: Use this url to download the report file.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Asynchronous report only. Id of the report.

fields.name: rows
fields.desc: Synchronous report only. Generated report rows.

fields.name: statisticsCurrencyCode
fields.desc: The currency code of all monetary values produced in the report, including values that are set by users (e.g., keyword bid settings) and metrics (e.g., cost and revenue). The currency code of a report is determined by the statisticsCurrency field of the report request.

fields.name: statisticsTimeZone
fields.desc: If all statistics of the report are sourced from the same time zone, this would be it. Otherwise the field is unset.

schemas.name: ReportRow
schemas.desc: A row in a DoubleClick Search report.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a SavedColumn resource. Value: the fixed string doubleclicksearch#savedColumn.

fields.name: savedColumnName
fields.desc: The name of the saved column.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The type of data this saved column will produce.

schemas.name: SavedColumnList
schemas.desc: A list of saved columns. Advertisers create saved columns to report on Floodlight activities, Google Analytics goals, or custom KPIs. To request reports with saved columns, you'll need the saved column names that are available from this list.

fields.name: items
fields.desc: The saved columns being requested.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies this as a SavedColumnList resource. Value: the fixed string doubleclicksearch#savedColumnList.

methods.name: generate
methods.desc: Generates and returns a report immediately.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Polls for the status of a report request.

pathParams.name: reportId
pathParams.desc: ID of the report request being polled.

methods.name: getFile
methods.desc: Downloads a report file encoded in UTF-8.

pathParams.name: reportFragment
pathParams.desc: The index of the report fragment to download.

methods.name: request
methods.desc: Inserts a report request into the reporting system.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Retrieve the list of saved columns for a specified advertiser.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Retrieves a list of conversions from a DoubleClick Search engine account.

pathParams.name: engineAccountId
pathParams.desc: Numeric ID of the engine account.

requiredQueryParams.name: endDate
requiredQueryParams.desc: Last date (inclusive) on which to retrieve conversions. Format is yyyymmdd.

requiredQueryParams.name: rowCount
requiredQueryParams.desc: The number of conversions to return per call.

requiredQueryParams.name: startDate
requiredQueryParams.desc: First date (inclusive) on which to retrieve conversions. Format is yyyymmdd.

requiredQueryParams.name: startRow
requiredQueryParams.desc: The 0-based starting index for retrieving conversions results.

optinalQueryParams.name: adGroupId
optinalQueryParams.desc: Numeric ID of the ad group.

methods.name: insert
methods.desc: Inserts a batch of new conversions into DoubleClick Search.

methods.name: patch
methods.desc: Updates a batch of conversions in DoubleClick Search. This method supports patch semantics.

requiredQueryParams.name: endDate
requiredQueryParams.desc: Last date (inclusive) on which to retrieve conversions. Format is yyyymmdd.

requiredQueryParams.name: engineAccountId
requiredQueryParams.desc: Numeric ID of the engine account.

requiredQueryParams.name: rowCount
requiredQueryParams.desc: The number of conversions to return per call.

requiredQueryParams.name: startDate
requiredQueryParams.desc: First date (inclusive) on which to retrieve conversions. Format is yyyymmdd.

requiredQueryParams.name: startRow
requiredQueryParams.desc: The 0-based starting index for retrieving conversions results.

methods.name: update
methods.desc: Updates a batch of conversions in DoubleClick Search.

methods.name: updateAvailability
methods.desc: Updates the availabilities of a batch of floodlight activities in DoubleClick Search.
